column2: Lumicel Animation Studios is hiring a Production Coordinator for international animation series production. The production coordinator plans daily assignments for animators, compositors, and the pre-production department. The coordinator provides the first point of contact for production team members. The Coordinator maintains production records and reports, communicates the day s scheduled events, arranges key meetings, and provides general animation production administrative support.     Essential Job Responsibilities       Plan production/project schedule and work assignment as per animation series delivery timeline         Enter and maintain production data in the studios production database, excel sheets and related production/project records to reflect scheduled, in-progress, and completed project work         Schedule meetings at the request of the Production Manager, Supervisor and Lead(s)         Proactively maintain the calendar with alertness to topics, deadlines and conflicts         Manage the schedules of key personnel and the production department         Ensure proper preparation for all meetings and reviews         Ensure daily tasks are assigned and work is delivered by all production team members on time and as per the schedule         Coordinate work that enters and leaves the production department to ensure completeness         Record and publish notes from meetings and reviews that accurately reflect action items         Meet production milestones and deadlines and motivate the team to do the same       Education and/or Experience Required:       Bachelor s Degree in Business, Engineering or MBA or with equivalent experience is preferred         Degree in Mass communication/Visual Media/ is a plus         2 years of work experience is required (will consider freshers with right attitude and passion of production administration or project management)         Computer literacy and ability to work with standard word-processing and spreadsheet software like Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint         Production Coordinator or assistant in animation production studio or television or broadcast studio is a plus         Strong ability to organize and prioritize         Ability to work under pressure and meet production deadlines         Experience working in a reputed animation studio, television studio, marketing/media production firms and international animation series is a plus         Drive, determination and creative problem-solving skills         Strong work ethic, communication skills, and an excellent team player

column2: As our RFP Marketing Production Manager, you will lead our marketing and web production team while also providing valuable insights and strategies in SEO, web analytics, and data science      Your primary responsibility is to ensure that all production operations are completed on schedule and to a high standard while leveraging data to inform our strategies and decision-making processes                  Years of Experience        At least 5 years managing a team of 5-10 team members.            Qualifications          MBA/MS in finance, business, or related field. BS degree with relevant management experience in the financial services industry will be considered.      Experience managing a team of 5-10 team members.      Strong project management skills to meet tight deadlines.      Excellent communication, leadership, and data presentation skills.      Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.      Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.      Proficiency in Qvidian or similar RFP content database management.      Experience with Seismic desirable.              Responsibilities          Oversee and manage a team of 5-10 writers who will be responsible for (1) producing high-quality first drafts of request for proposals (RFP) and due diligence questionnaires (DDQ); (2) maintaining Vital Stats, our centralized source of firm-wide facts and figures used in sales and marketing materials; and (3) maintaining monthly and quarterly updates on third-party database platforms such as eVestment and Morningstar.      Have a high-level understanding of Russell Investments OCIO and customized portfolio solutions businesses. A solid understanding of investment products, asset classes, and financial markets is a plus.      Maintain efficient processes to ensure content is current, accurate, and tailored to meet the specific requirements of each RFP. Attention to detail is a must.      Qvidian RFP database management: Regularly review and enhance content to improve response quality and consistency.      Coordinate with RFP writers, subject matter experts, and marketing managers in all the regions in which Russell Investments operates, and understand the distinctions in each.      Manage resource allocation effectively to ensure timelines are met.      Promote a strong collaborative team environment that encourages creativity and innovation.      Conduct regular meetings with the team to discuss progress, address challenges, implement best practices, and onboarding feedback from RFP writers and other stakeholders.      Provide training, support, and guidance to team members to enhance their skills and performance, particularly in tailoring responses from stock answers.      Monitor the performance of the team and individual members, providing constructive feedback and implementing performance improvement strategies when needed.      Stay updated with the latest technologies in RFP/data management.              Core Values            Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and collaboration skills with all levels of management          Strong organizational skills including the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet frequent deadlines,          Demonstrated proactive approach to problem-solving with strong judgment and decision-making capability.          Highly resourceful and collaborative team-player, with the ability to also be independently effective and exude initiative and a sense of urgency.          Exemplifies our customer-focused, action-oriented, results-driven culture.          Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities, has a desire for continuous learning, and proposes solutions.          Ability to act with discretion and maintain complete confidentiality.          Dedicated to the firm s values of non-negotiable integrity, valuing our people, exceeding client expectations, and embracing intellectual curiosity and rigor.

column2: Project Planning and Execution: Assist in planning and executing electrical projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.        Team Management: Supervise and coordinate the work of electrical engineers, technicians, and other staff involved in project execution. Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to team members as needed.          Resource Management: Allocate resources effectively to ensure smooth project execution. This includes managing manpower, materials, equipment, and subcontractors.          Quality Assurance: Ensure that all electrical work meets relevant quality standards, codes, and regulations. Conduct regular inspections and quality checks to identify and address any issues or deviations.          Safety Compliance: Promote a culture of safety and ensure that all electrical work is carried out in accordance with safety regulations and best practices. Implement and enforce safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries.          Client Communication: Serve as a primary point of contact for clients and stakeholders regarding electrical execution matters. Provide regular updates on project progress, address any concerns or queries, and ensure client satisfaction.          Troubleshooting and Problem-solving: Identify and resolve any technical or logistical challenges that arise during project execution. Troubleshoot electrical issues and implement effective solutions in a timely manner.          Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of project activities, including progress reports, documentation of changes, and correspondence with stakeholders. Prepare and present reports to management as required.          Cost Management: Assist in budgeting and cost estimation for electrical projects. Monitor project expenses and implement cost-saving measures where possible to ensure projects are completed within budget.          Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to electrical execution. Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.          Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant electrical codes, standards, and regulations. Keep abreast of any changes or updates to ensure ongoing compliance throughout project execution.          Risk Management: Identify potential risks and uncertainties that may impact project execution. Develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize disruption and ensure project success.          Vendor Management: Liaise with vendors and suppliers to procure materials and equipment required for electrical projects. Negotiate contracts, monitor vendor performance, and resolve any issues or disputes that may arise.          Training and Development: Coordinate training and development programs for electrical execution team members to enhance their skills and knowledge. Foster a culture of learning and professional growth within the team.          Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including clients, contractors, regulatory authorities, and other relevant parties. Ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.

column2: General Manager - Biodiesel Production About BCL Industries Ltd:   BCL Industries Ltd is a renowned listed company with a strong presence in the production of edible oils, grain-based ethanol, and Extra Neutral Alcohol (ENA). Committed to sustainable practices and innovative solutions, BCL Industries Ltd is expanding its operations to include biodiesel production. The company's new biodiesel production unit, located in Bathinda, Punjab, is set to operate at a capacity of 75 thousand liters per day (KLPD). Job Description:   BCL Industries Ltd is seeking a highly skilled and experienced General Manager for their Biodiesel Production unit. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in setting up and overseeing the efficient operation of the biodiesel plant post-commissioning. Key Responsibilities:   Unit Setup :  Collaborate with the project team to ensure the successful setup and commissioning of the biodiesel production unit, adhering to industry standards and regulatory requirements. Operational Management:  Oversee day-to-day operations of the biodiesel plant, including production scheduling, inventory management, and quality control to ensure optimal performance and maximum output. Process Optimization:  Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance process efficiency, reduce production costs, and maximize resource utilization. Compliance and Safety:  Ensure compliance with all environmental, health, and safety regulations governing biodiesel production operations. Develop and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) to maintain a safe and sustainable work environment. Team Leadership:  Build and lead a skilled team of professionals, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure smooth operations and foster a culture of excellence and accountability. Vendor Management:  Liaise with suppliers, vendors, and service providers to procure raw materials, equipment, and services required for uninterrupted operation of the biodiesel plant. Budgeting and Cost Control:  Develop and manage budgets for the biodiesel production unit, monitoring expenses and implementing cost-saving measures to optimize financial performance. Qualifications and Experience:   Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, or related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in biodiesel production or related industries, with a proven track record of successful project management and operational leadership. In-depth knowledge of biodiesel production processes, equipment, and technologies. Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and industry standards governing biodiesel production. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Proven ability to drive process optimization, cost reduction, and continuous improvement initiatives. Prior experience in setting up and commissioning biodiesel production units would be an advantage.   Location :  Bathinda, Punjab, India Industry :  Edible Oils, Grain Based Ethanol, ENA Production
column11: Plant Operations, Production Management

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced MES (Manufacturing Execution System) Lead specializing in production to join our team. The MES Lead will be responsible for overseeing the implementation, optimization, and support of MES solutions within our production environment. Responsibilities: Lead the implementation and deployment of MES solutions for production processes, including requirement gathering, solution design, configuration, testing, and go-live activities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including manufacturing, engineering, IT, and quality assurance, to define business requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Develop and maintain detailed project plans, timelines, and deliverables for MES implementation projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines. Provide leadership and guidance to MES project teams, including consultants, developers, and business analysts, to ensure successful project execution and delivery. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize and standardize production processes using MES capabilities, such as real-time monitoring, data analytics, and workflow automation. Serve as the subject matter expert for MES solutions, providing training, support, and troubleshooting assistance to end-users and stakeholders. Develop and maintain documentation, procedures, and best practices for MES system administration, configuration, and usage. Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in MES and production management, and incorporate them into solution designs and implementations. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. years of experience in MES implementation and support, with a focus on production processes. Strong understanding of manufacturing operations and production workflows, including shop floor control, work order management, and quality management. Experience with leading MES platforms such as Siemens Camstar, Rockwell Software FactoryTalk ProductionCentre, or Dassault Systmes DELMIA Apriso. Proficiency in MES configuration, customization, and integration with other enterprise systems such as ERP and PLM. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Ability to travel to customer sites for project implementation and support activities, as needed.

Other duties may be assigned.       Participates in and provides direction for the long-term planning of manufacturing and supply chain operational strategies, objectives, and plans needed to deliver results. Directs the implementation of plans.      Aligns manufacturing and supply chain standards and processes across assigned areas. Applies the TQM (Total Quality Management) approach in department activities. Maintains quality control standards. Ensures data gathering, analysis, and corrective actions are put in place to improve performance and reduce costs.      Develops and deploys Supply Chain Management (SCM) strategy to optimize performance in supply chain reliability, responsiveness, flexibility, costs, and asset management efficiency.    Oversees structured cost reduction efforts and drives extensive cost reduction through process improvements. column2: The Production Manager manages the end-to-end production of print and retail display projects. The PM will also be expected to mentor and upskill the Production Executives and face the client directly.         You will work within your team and other relevant departments on the delivery of client production activities with the highest compliance and quality standards.         You will have accountability for the accuracy, quality, timeliness and profitability of multiple campaigns and projects by managing the briefing, scheduling and delivery process on behalf of the client.         You will help drive the effectiveness of our internal delivery processes and by doing so maintain client profitability.         Manage and fulfill BTL (print, POSM, displays) needs of the marketing team of the company s global and local clients.         Strategic Thinking         Create a collaborative environment and stimulate discussion on upcoming projects and requirements in the production space         Confidently demonstrate your knowledge as a subject matter expert and are happy to field questions and find solutions         Process Focus         Pro-actively propose continuous improvement initiatives to your line manager or wider team, as well as provide advice on strategic campaigns         Campaign Management         Be comfortable with managing briefs         Be comfortable questioning a brief to ensure you can effectively deliver it.         Provide regular campaign updates and proactively communicate the next steps to the SPM or TL in advance.         Produce clear campaign plans and manage client expectations confidently throughout the delivery of a project.         Ensure all activity reports are accurate and deliver value to your client based on their reporting requirements         Provide adequate support to the Client Services team when required from thorough spec completion and following the required ways of working         Analytical Skills: Data Quality, Reporting and Insights          Understand the importance of data quality and its business impact follow compliance processes to ensure data accuracy at all times.         Present monthly review of savings and projects delivered highlighting key achievements, challenges and progress against reciprocal KPI s         Understand why savings are up/down and proactively take steps to collaborate with key stakeholders to improve performance and ensure data accuracy and completeness         Negotiations Management         Manage team and supplier conversations to find mutually beneficial outcomes, be it in terms of savings, value engineering, quality, etc.         Skills, knowledge, experience and exposure:         The Production Manager will likely have    7+ years of Print POSM production management experience   .         Relevant project management and supplier liaison experience will also be considered positively.         Industry background or education will be strongly positive.         Fluency both written and spoken in English.         Client Interfacing skills for management of the account.         Mindset to navigate the role         Clear and effective communication skills at all levels in the hierarchy         A solution-orientated and resolution mindset, where problems are just the starting point for finding solutions.         A problem-solving mindset, as the nature of the role will require to navigate different types of challenges and new scenarios.         A technology-oriented mindset, as you will have to use different technologies in your daily job         Attention to detail is critical in the Production Managers role         Good mediation skills, as you will act as one of the links between Indicia Worldwide and the suppliers         The softer skills that we believe will help you thrive in this role:         A positive can-do attitude at all times, setting an example for team members         A high level of energy when delivering and the ability to face challenges in a serene and collaborative manner.         A curious mind, i.e. wanting to know all about internal operations and processes, aiming for continuous improvement.         Accountability: you are a professional and we will treat you as such. You will be expected to manage your workload and to raise your hand when you need team support         Collaborative spirit: use we, not me. If someone is in trouble, you will do your best to support.         A good communications skillset with both internal and external teams         Exceptional prioritization skills         A strong ability to work under pressure and to comply with deadlines.         Role Requirements         An    onsite model    applies to this role, which requires one being at the client s office in    Bangalore    alongside the marketing team five days a week.         Travel to conferences or client events might be required on occasion.         Whilst the contracted hours for the role are 9.00am to 5:30pm, Mon Fri, the project-based nature of the role requires that some days you will have to work outside of these hours, and you will recover that time in other moments.

column2: The role is responsible for Planning, monitoring and execution of Shop Maintenance; responsible for upkeep of the line, installation and certification of new equipment, to ensure optimum uptime    Dimensions of the position        Safety: Ensure safe work place by monitoring TRCFR LTI    Quality: To achieve DRR DRL target as per goal sheet    Productivity: To meet MOP target as per plan    Delivery: Ensure production in given schedule time    Cost: Adhere to the FCC and VCC target as per target in goal sheet    Morale: Ensure morale of the team        Environment: Ensure Environment aspects also per targets in goal sheet    Personal Profile        Education B.E./B. Tech (Mechanical/Elec./EnTC/Paint Technology)        Skills/ Competencies      1. Driving Execution    2. Customer Centricity    3. Leading Change    4. Operations Management    5. Business and financial acumen    6. Problem solving orientation.    7. Risk management    Relevant Experience :    1. Must possess overall experience of 3-7 years in the Shop technology, and must possess sound technical knowledge of Maintenance for the respective Shop with minimum 4-6 cycles in Line Maintenance      Key Responsibilities:    S.N. Key Responsibility Key Tasks Measures    1 Annual Maintenance Planning    Identify the probable major breakdown issues in the shop and prepare an annual maintenance plan    Finalize the preventive maintenance (PM) schedule based on the specific machine requirements breakdown analysis for assigned shop on an annual basis    Monitor the adherence to the PM schedule and take necessary corrective action(if any) on a monthly basis    Shutdown Maintenance Planning and overhauling of the equipment as per schedule    Annual Maintenance budget    Maintenance cost / Veh (Rs.)        2 Breakdown maintenance management    Review the breakdown maintenance reports and take necessary actions to maximize the uptime of machines on a daily basis    Analyze the breakdowns and plan for counter measures in case of repetitive breakdowns on a weekly basis    Take necessary actions (Kaizen, skill improvements etc.) to reduce repair time for machines through and review progress on a monthly basis          Education              Work Experience        Knowledge of Siemens, Allen Bradley PLC trouble shooting and modifications of Logic.    Knowledge of AC/DC Drives ( Siemens, Control Techniques).    Handling of Kuka Robotics System.    Networking systems like Profibus, Interbus, Profinet, Ethernet.    HMI tplanrouble shooting and Programming (WinCC Flex, Rs View)    Basic Maintenance knowledge of Kuka Robotics and Automation.    Plan for machine reconditioning in case of repetitive breakdown analysis and safety requirements MTBF MTTR    % uptime    Adherence to PM        3 New installations Management    Provide technical specifications to the Planning team prior to procurement of machines based on the past breakdown trends, new safety quality requirements    Conduct technical assessment (provision for insurance spares, warranty, service support etc.) on Request to Quote (RFQ) bids received from the supplier and provide feedback to the Planning department prior to commercial negotiations and vendor finalization    Participate in DAP (Design Approval Process) discussions and finalize the facilities layout and plan along with Planning CPED Departments    Conduct the trials on new machines and review the snag point closure status on a weekly basis along with the PTPA Department    Verify various reports (snag point closure status, machine geometrical accuracy reports and quality related reports) and take the handover from Technical Services for regular operations Timeline adherence    4 Supplier Management    Plan the availability of spares for machine recovery from contingencies; Salvage spares to reduce maintenance cost    Optimise spares inventory to monitor timely repair, replacement upgradation    Participate in inspections trials at the supplier location prior to delivery in case of critical items % Availability of spares      5 Quality Management    Track, analyze and report daily quality figures (caused by maintenance related issues) in team meetings    Sustenance of process capability of critical and major dimensions in machining            Tata Motors Leadership Competencies        Customer Centricity - Anticipating, understanding and focusing efforts on meeting the customer (stakeholders) needs or expectations      Developing Self and Others - Recognizing continuous development is essential for success and taking steps to develop self and helping others to excel      Driving Execution - Translating strategy into action and execution      Leading by Example - Encouraging and following ethical standards      Leading Change - Recognizing the need for change, initiating and adapting to change      Motivating Self and Others - Inspiring teams and individuals            Functional Competencies

column2: ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Resource Management: Coordinate with other departments to effectively allocate resources (materials, machinery, and manpower) for maximum productivity. Manage inventory levels to avoid understocking or overstocking. Conduct worker meetings to ensure efficient resource utilization. Method Analysis: Determine the most suitable production methods for manufacturing goods and services. Optimize processes to enhance efficiency and quality. Quality Assurance: Maintain standard quality of products and services produced. Ensure compliance with safety measures during production. Monitor workers performance and address any quality-related issues. Timely Delivery: Oversee production schedules to meet deadlines. Coordinate with logistics and supply chain teams for on-time delivery. Cost Management: Estimate costs and prepare budgets for production activities. Implement cost reduction strategies without compromising quality. Workflow Organization: Organize workflow to meet specifications and deadlines. Streamline processes to minimize bottlenecks and maximize output. Continuous Improvement: Analyze equipment and workforce performance to identify areas for enhancement. Adopt new production techniques to increase efficiency. Integrate  Lean Manufacturing  principles to eliminate waste and improve process flow. Implement Industry 4.0 based cost effective systems. Work on implementing low cost automation concepts that will help improve productivity and help improve the quality of the end product. Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE): Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of production equipment. Calculate OEE metrics (availability, performance, and quality) to identify opportunities for improvement. Implement strategies to enhance equipment uptime and reduce downtime. Communication and Leadership: Facilitate effective communication within the company. Align production goals with organizational objectives. PREFERRED CANDIDATE PROFILE: Education: A bachelors degree in engineering, manufacturing, or a related field is typically preferred. Relevant certifications (e.g., Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing) are advantageous. Experience: Several years of experience in production management, preferably in the automotive industry. Exposure to stamping processes and auto component manufacturing is highly desirable. Skills: Strong leadership and communication skills. Analytical mindset for process optimization. Experience in Stamping Industry. Proficiency in production planning software and tools. MS Office Suite: Microsoft Excel:  Proficient for data analysis and reporting. Microsoft PowerPoint:  Ability to create effective presentations. SAP System Experience:  Familiarity with SAP modules, especially SAP PP, for efficient production management. PERKS & BENEFITS: Educational Assistance For Kids Health Insurance Travel Claims

column2: Reporting to the Site Director, the incumbent is responsible for maintaining/ establishing the Lab facility of BD TCI and upkeep including forecasting, scheduling, and assignment of daily lab tasks working closely with the Lab Technicians from other Business platforms      The Lab Manager is also responsible for development and preparation of performance metrics      Additionally, the Lab Manager is responsible for identifying, planning, scheduling, and executing lab improvement projects                  Job Responsibilities:      (Primary Duties, Roles, and/or Authorities)            The Lab Manager is an individual contributor role working with cross functional BU s/ platforms to support them in the Design Verification Tests, Feasibility testing etc.        Set up the expansion of the current Laboratory based on requirements that may come up in BD TCI      Work with global counterparts to understand the various test requirements and specific Lab Certifications (ISO/FDA) and recommend capabilities to be developed in BD TCI.      Meets with all R&D project teams (across Platforms) to receive testing forecasts      Works closely with different platforms and their lab team to ensure smooth operations of the lab      Manage end to end Budget for the LAB      Understanding of QMS, Defect management procedures and EHS (environmental health and safety) requirements and ensures strict compliance.      Coordinates and ensures Calibration / Preventive Maintenance / repair schedule with adequate documentation      Maintains all relevant documentation and presents as needed for quality Audits.      Clear understanding of FAI and IQ/OQ/PQ.      Fields testing needs forecasts and requests from non-project sources (e.g QA, Marketing, TMD,etc)      Addresses inconsistencies on test needs/requests with requestors      Converts incoming individual test needs into test requests within the lab tracking systems      Translates forecasts into daily schedules and hosts a daily shift startup meeting      Adjusts daily schedules for emergencies      Identifies gaps and improvement needs within the lab      Develops goals and project plans based on identified needs      Creates corresponding schedules and work assignments for project completion      Executes Continuous Improvement projects in the following (but not limited to) areas      Equipment or method troubleshooting/repairs      Coordinates with Test Method Development and Verification & Validation team for equipment and method validations      Method or Equipment Upgrades      Fixture maintenance      Drawing or Specification modifications      Adopt Automation initiatives          Creates ACR/ECR for Changes generated from CI projects      Maintains the Tool Crib and Fixture inventory      Addresses concerns / issues from project teams regarding test results or equipment/method inconsistencies      Maintains metrics that demonstrate measurable improvements      Maintains good laboratory practices (GLP) consistent with MDS product development objectives and regulatory guidelines.      Participates as primary contact for Lab related questions during audits      Performs other duties as required.      Proficiency in Microsoft Project or equivalent project planning software      Demonstrated versatility and learning agility and Team oriented.      Basic understanding of business / finance concepts (e.g. payback, rate of return, cashflow, income statement, etc.)          Education and Experience:          Bachelors in relevant field is required (i.e. Mechanical/ Materials/ Chemical/ Industrial) or any other advanced degree. Minimum experience of 8+ years (not more than 12 Years) with 5 years of direct laboratory management experience and a minimum of 2 years of supervisory experience.      Experience with managing labs related to medical devices.          Knowledge and Skills:          Knowledge of the operation of mechanical measurement equipment (e.g. Instron) desirable.      Operation of diagnostic instrumentation desirable.      Superior communication skills, both written and oral.      Knowledge of computer programs      Knowledge of statistical analysis desirable.
column11: EHS, Automation, Medical devices, ISO, Instrumentation, Project planning, Scheduling, GLP, Troubleshooting, Forecasting

column2: Amanta Lifesciences is looking for Sr      Manager / Manager - Production to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Production Planning: Develop and implement production plans, schedules, and strategies to meet output targets while optimizing resources and minimizing costs     Team Management: Lead and manage production teams, including supervisors, technicians, and operators, ensuring a cohesive and motivated workforce     Quality Control: Implement quality control measures, inspections, and process improvements to maintain high-quality standards and compliance with regulations     Operational Efficiency: Optimize production processes, workflows, and resource utilization to improve efficiency, reduce waste, and enhance productivity     Inventory Management: Oversee inventory levels, stock control, and material availability to ensure uninterrupted production and minimize shortages     Health and Safety: Ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations, promoting a safe working environment for production staff     Budgeting and Cost Control: Manage production budgets, analyze costs, and implement cost-saving initiatives without compromising quality     Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process enhancements, automation, and technology upgrades to streamline operations and enhance output     Qualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Operations Management, Manufacturing, or a related field     Extensive experience (usually 5-10+ years) in a manufacturing or production environment, progressively in leadership roles     In-depth knowledge of production processes, manufacturing techniques, and quality management systems     Strong leadership, decision-making, and problem-solving skills     Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement methodologies is beneficial     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams     Key Attributes:Leadership and team-building skills to manage and motivate production teams     Analytical mindset to assess production data, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions     Strategic thinking to align production goals with overall company objectives     Adaptability to changing production demands and environments     Results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving production targets while maintaining quality standards

column2: Basic Function and Scope of Responsibilities              (     other duties as assigned):               Reporting to the VP of Operations, the incumbent is responsible for the total operations of Mill 4 in East Berlin which consists of producing products to quality standards at the lowest possible cost by effective use of assigned resources (ie. Personnel, raw materials, equipment, and supporting services). Duties relative to this role will be scheduling, receiving, production and shipping of products to meet customer requirements and quality control standards.                Principal Responsibilities:                        Works with VP of Operations to develop yearly budgets and ensure adherence to meet plan. Plan and execute cost-savings measures as needed.                 Plan and execute priorities set with the VP of Operations which will include weekly production schedules, fumigation schedules, mill inspections, sanitation schedule, and safety training.                 Responsible for the development of direct reports providing feedback through disciplinary counseling, time and attendance, terminations, performance reviews, developmental plans, and salary reviews.                 Ensure government compliance (DEP, EPA, OSHA, Internal ISO, HACCP, GMP (Global (GAP), FSMA (Food Safety Modernization Act.                 Develop and maintain programs for reduction of operating costs, extra work, year-round shift rotation, schedule, and overtime requirements.                 Maintains a high level of communication and coordination of three shifts.                 Assist Human Resources in the interview process and selection of new employees.                 Control and monitor overtime costs, inventory management, production output, plant efficiency, safety policies, and a significant commitment to year-end inventory.                 Maintain high product quality and sanitation standards. Partners with QA to resolve customer complaints, non-conformities, and corrective-preventative action requests.                 Directs operations to meet ISO and production standards, schedules, and customer requirements.                 Participates in plant-wide audits which includes and is not limited to (ie. NOAA, HACCP, ISO).                  Member of the Operations Leadership and Order Management team.                 Ensure the security of facilities along with food and defense security programs.                  Maintains a high level of communications with Maintenance, Purchasing, Tech Service, Transportation, Shipping (both locations), Customer Service Depts. regarding all production schedule items.                  Manages the Pest Control Program for Mill 4 and offsite warehouse at East Berlin.                Educational Requirements:                        High School Diploma or Equivalent                  Bachelor Degree preferred                Training, Skills, Knowledge and/or Experience:                        Mechanical Aptitude /Automated Manufacturing Systems.                  Five years feed manufacturing experience in a senior supervisory role with exposure to all areas of a plant s operations.                  Broad knowledge of manufacturing methods, production planning, and employee relations.                  Knowledge of automated manufacturing systems.                  Good verbal and written communication skills.                  Excellent interpersonal skills.                  Strong problem-solving skills.                  Supervisory Skills.               Competencies:                        Must be comfortable communicating with all areas of the company from management to manufacturing floor.                 Able to react quickly to changing demands of production schedule.                 Able to promote teamwork and cooperation between departments to obtain company objectives.                Contacts:                        All departments across the company organization.                  Consultants                  Customers                  Government Regulatory Agencies                  Manufacturing Personnel                  Outside Contractors / Vendors                  Temporary Employment Agencies                  Auditors                           Supervisory Responsibility:                        Has Supervisory responsibility over Mill 4 Manufacturing Operation                Working Conditions                      Physical surrounding:               Basic computer knowledge, printer, scanner, and other machines as required.                Adverse working environment:                Must be able to sustain daily exposure to dust, noise, heat, and cold.          Exposure to dangerous machinery and other hazardous conditions requiring safety adherence to PPE, safety rules, and procedures at all times.                Physical Effort:                   Must be able to sit, stand, walk, climb on a continuous basis.          Must pass a job-related pre-employment physical and drug-alcohol screening   . column2: Project Planning and Execution           : Assist in planning and executing electrical projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.                           Team Management           : Supervise and coordinate the work of electrical engineers, technicians, and other staff involved in project execution. Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to team members as needed.                           Resource Management           : Allocate resources effectively to ensure smooth project execution. This includes managing manpower, materials, equipment, and subcontractors.                           Quality Assurance           : Ensure that all electrical work meets relevant quality standards, codes, and regulations. Conduct regular inspections and quality checks to identify and address any issues or deviations.                           Safety Compliance           : Promote a culture of safety and ensure that all electrical work is carried out in accordance with safety regulations and best practices. Implement and enforce safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries.                           Client Communication           : Serve as a primary point of contact for clients and stakeholders regarding electrical execution matters. Provide regular updates on project progress, address any concerns or queries, and ensure client satisfaction.                           Troubleshooting and Problem-solving           : Identify and resolve any technical or logistical challenges that arise during project execution. Troubleshoot electrical issues and implement effective solutions in a timely manner.                           Documentation and Reporting           : Maintain accurate records of project activities, including progress reports, documentation of changes, and correspondence with stakeholders. Prepare and present reports to management as required.                           Cost Management           : Assist in budgeting and cost estimation for electrical projects. Monitor project expenses and implement cost-saving measures where possible to ensure projects are completed within budget.                           Continuous Improvement           : Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to electrical execution. Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. column2: Reporting to the      Facility Manager     , the Maintenance Manager      is responsible for         leading the maintenance management and execution of the Air Products      Barauni     facility.             Working alongside the Plant     Supervisors      to ensure the smooth and reliable operation and maintenance of all aspects of the plant, with the      aim of achieving the highest plant reliability and availability, whilst controlling maintenance related costs in line with the business needs.                               Nature and Scope                                       ?         The     Barauni     Plant is Air Products first fully owned and operated plant in India; it      represents     a significant investment and includes State of the Art technology which makes it advanced Hydrogen Plant within the Corporation.                                         ?           The plant consists of      2     main elements: -                                         1 x Large Technip Steam Methane Reformer (SMR) with Air Products PSA s for H2 purification.                     An Air Products Air Separation Unit (ASU) Producing Nitrogen                                        The scope of maintenance for the Production Plants, equipment and associated systems includes: -                             Compressors, Electrical distribution systems, Switch gear, Generators, Motors, Fans, Pumps (cryogenic and other), Pressure Vessels and piping systems, Relief Valves, Heat exchangers, Furnaces, Burners, Cryogenic turbines, Computer control systems, Trip Systems, Analysis equipment etc                                     The customer is      Indian Oil     Corporation Ltd. (     IO     CL),      Barauni     refinery and the Air Products plant is      located     within the customer s site. The products from the Air Products plants go directly to the customer as part of their refinery expansion. There is      a high level     of integration between      IO     CL and Air Products with respect to feedstock s,      products     and utilities. The products are critical to refinery unit operations.              The plants run on continuous basis and there is a strong emphasis of high reliability and high efficiency with contractual penalties against Air Products for underperformance.             Air Products owns,      operates     and maintains Hydrogen Plants and      ASU s     around the globe with Operations in over 50 countries,      in excess of             100 hydrogen plants and 350 ASU s         . As such we have a wealth of      expertise     and have we'll established work processes in place for the reliable and efficient operation of our plants. The Maintenance Manger will be expected to work closely with the Global Communities of      expertise     and ensure consistent compliance with these work processes.             Prior to facility operation the individual will have a period of training before plant commissioning begins, where they will have a role setting up the permanent site maintenance team,      establishing     site procedures and      participating     in plant commissioning.                                Principle Responsibilities                         Ensure that the plants are      maintained     in a safe and serviceable condition, so that they can consistently      attain     the reliability and performance targets necessary to meet the business needs.                       Implementation of specific maintenance programmes such as statutory, condition based and Preventive Maintenance     .      Optimisation of these maintenance programmes.                     Work with Air Products Materials Management Department to ensure that the correct spare parts are held in locations and quantities that meet the business needs of the Plant.                     Comply with     Key Performance Indicator (KPI) targets.                     Be capable      to take     any corrective action      required     to ensure the continuity of production and the safety of the equipment and personnel by making use of all the available information. Ensure all site breakdowns are repaired and completed in      a timely     /prioritized manner.                                     Prepare the Maintenance Budget in conjunction with Plant, Line and Business Management.                 Ensure that the agreed maintenance budgets are not exceeded and that year-on-year underlying cost reductions are delivered whilst reducing unplanned events and their consequential business costs.                  Accountable for keeping maintenance expenditure within budget.                 Provide     leadership for and manage the maintenance organization that supports the Air Products     Baraun     i Facility.                         Ensure that the organization is staffed and developed to      provide     the required maintenance support and service level in support of the business      objectives     .                     Drive a culture in which work is done correctly      first     time and re-work is eliminated.                           Safety performance of staff and contractors. Ensure that a strong safety culture is developed and      maintained     .                           Ensure maintenance is executed in compliance with EH&S requirements.                     Contribute to the development of EH&S related procedures in support of maintenance activities.                               Drive Contractor and Air Products Maintenance Health & Safety Excellence through actively      participating     in plant s safety program,      promoting     and enforcing global safety procedures and good housekeeping methods, and by directing & administrating outside maintenance resources to meet and exceed all      EH&S      regulations, and company requirements.                      Ensure adherence to Permit to Work system and contractor induction training is completed to      maintain     the      high level     of safety for all site work                                     Use SAP for managing maintenance and the spare parts associated with the Plant.                                              Maintenance Manager Decision Making Authority                                   ?         Job      Holder         :                 New staff      selection                     Staff training                 Emergency mobilization of staff                 Maintenance priorities on      Barauni     plants                 Equipment maintenance decisions                 Planning and management of plant maintenance shutdowns                     Award of orders to contractors, equipment vendors, and workshop services                                                   Shared:                       Maintenance policy                 Staff resource requirements                 Type and level of capital spares holding.                 Setting maintenance budgets                 Equipment operating decisions                                                     MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS                                       A bachelors degree in engineering with minimum          15                 years in a maintenance related role in refinery, ammonia, methanol, chemical process, power generation, marine industries or similar.                     A track record     in which strong technical and practical engineering skills have been demonstrated     .                      Should have an in-depth knowledge of the construction and maintenance of large and complex rotating equipment (e.g., Compressors, pumps, expanders     ), good     working knowledge of      Static Equipment,      good working knowledge of control and instrumentation systems, good working knowledge of electrical equipment and systems     and good working knowledge in Civil Maintenance.                 Must be a capable user of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems, ideally SAP.                     Prior maintenance management experience is necessary with considerable management and leadership skills      for:-                                 Management of a team that often performs in high intensity periods of site work such as maintenance shutdowns, in which a large number of outside contractors are employed, often having a different approach to Air Products normal      expectation     .                     Development and motivation of staff to be prepared, at short notice, to work long and unsociable hours, in often difficult and      pressurized     situations, whilst      maintaining     enthusiasm, standards of safety, and work quality.                     Budget Preparation, Cost Control and Budget Monitoring                     Contractor Management                     Spares Management                                 Knowledge of local Health &      Safety      ,         Labour     law     and Statutory Compliances.                                         Excellent Communication & coordination skills.                                         Fluent in oral and written English      / Hindi Language.

column1: Area In Charge - Electric Arc Furnace
column2: Position Overview:  The Area In Charge will be responsible for leading and managing all aspects of the Zero Power Furnace/Electric Arc Furnace operations within the Steel Melting Shop. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, leadership skills, and a strong focus on safety, quality, and efficiency. Key Responsibilities: 1. Operations Management: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Zero Power Furnace/Electric Arc Furnace, including charging, melting, refining, and tapping processes. Coordinate with shift supervisors and operators to ensure smooth and efficient furnace operations, optimizing production output while maintaining quality standards. 2. Team Leadership: Lead a team of furnace operators, technicians, and support staff, providing guidance, training, and performance feedback. Foster a culture of safety, teamwork, and continuous improvement within the department. 3. Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce quality control procedures to ensure the production of steel meets customer specifications and industry standards. Conduct regular inspections and quality checks throughout the melting and refining processes, addressing any deviations or issues promptly. 4. Maintenance and Reliability: Develop and execute preventive maintenance schedules for Zero Power Furnace/Electric Arc Furnace equipment, minimizing downtime and maximizing equipment reliability. Coordinate with maintenance teams to address equipment breakdowns, troubleshoot technical issues, and implement corrective actions. 5. Process Optimization: Identify opportunities for process optimization and efficiency improvements within the melting and refining operations. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process upgrades, technology advancements, and cost-saving initiatives. 6. Safety and Compliance: Ensure compliance with all safety regulations, policies, and procedures, promoting a safe work environment for all employees. Conduct regular safety audits, hazard assessments, and incident investigations, implementing corrective actions as needed.

column2: Job Title: Plant Manager Position Overview:  The Plant Manager is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of our manufacturing facility. This role involves managing production processes, ensuring quality standards, optimizing efficiency, and maintaining a safe working environment. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in electrical enclosures and sheet metal manufacturing, as well as strong leadership skills. Responsibilities: Shop Floor Management: Supervise production activities, including assembly, machining, and finishing. Monitor workflow, allocate resources, and ensure timely completion of orders. Collaborate with production teams to meet production targets. Inventory Management: Maintain accurate inventory records. Coordinate with procurement and logistics teams to optimize stock levels. Implement inventory control measures to minimize waste and stockouts. Quality Assurance: Ensure products meet quality standards. Implement quality control processes and address any deviations. Work closely with the quality team to improve product quality. Planning and Scheduling: Develop production schedules based on demand forecasts. Allocate resources efficiently to meet production goals. Adjust schedules as needed to accommodate changes in demand or production capacity. Safety and Compliance: Promote a safe working environment. Enforce safety protocols and address any safety concerns promptly. Ensure compliance with environmental regulations and company policies. Performance Metrics: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to production, efficiency, and quality. Identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Engineering, Operations Management, or a related field. Minimum 20 years of experience in manufacturing, with a focus on electrical enclosures and sheet metal. Strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate and manage teams effectively. Proficiency in inventory management software and production planning tools. Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

column2: To manage and lead a team of people in allocating workload and managing the day to day operations in the workshop. It requires the job holder to co-ordinate resources and liaise with internal and external key contacts to ensure work is delivered on time and to a quality standard.                           Key Responsibilities & Authorities                               Sets up of the workshop and implementation of system that will allow for both physical and system stock control, asset movement monitoring, and organized procurement                                 Assist the workshop Manager to establish production lines at workshop.                                  Assist to run the facility, production lines, machines and manpower, main task to deliver the final product based on company procedures and work process flow.                                 Ensure raw material is available at workshop based on minimum stock qty and commercial projects plan, consider sales forecast input to secure the raw material.                                 Assist in preparing and managing the production plan, weekly report, monthly report.                                  Create yearly or quarterly budget for running the workshop.                                  To be able to resolve all technical issues of all production lines at workshop: production lines are Polyurethane, mechanical production, electronics and Assembly.                                  Each production line must have its conveyor system, plan, input and output, workshop manager to ensure conveyor system is implemented to run every production line                                 Prepare BOM; based on mechanical / electronics design.                                  Ensure purchasing job is done to procure all needed material for production line.                                 All type shipment for workshop, raw material for production lines or final product going out from workshop to our client, all shipment is planned, execution will be done by supply chain team but assistant workshop manager is the main responsible person to ensure no miss and all activities are planned under his direct control and responsibilities.                                  Follow up with supply chain personnel to ensure workshop store has all type raw material required for production line. all issues must be reported to corporate office                                 Two main plans should be always implemented at the workshop, production and improvement plans.                                  Assistant Workshop manager has to report to territory director for all administrative related tasks, all technical and workshop running tasks will be reported to Workshop Manager and corporate office, Sr production manager or production director.                                  Assistant Workshop manager will approve material request / service request on ERP, assistant workshop manager to ensure we buy/outsource the material which is really needed for production line or commercial projects or to secure the store for minimum stock, ensure we will not have non-moving items in the store.                                  Responsible for optimum utilization of resources available for the workshop in terms of machinery, manpower, utilities, consumables etc for the various jobs being conducted.                                 To ensure that the activities of the workshop are well coordinated in order to complete the jobs received within the allocated time frame, quality parameters, class requirements and budgeted cost.                                 Assures that minimum stock requirements per quarter are set and orders placed in time for required tools and spares.                                 To develop and implement procedures for requisition of bill of materials and other resources from stores and purchase department and liaison with sub contractors to get material and ensure their payments are made on time.                                  Responsible for budgets for the purchase of materials, fixings and fastenings and machine tools to ensure the smooth progression of projects through the workshop.                                 To develop and implement a system to ensure regular maintenance service for the machinery and for breakdown related activities.                                 Completion and submission of all the required documentation to support the workshop activities including damage reports, repair procedures, quality tests and results, completion reports, additional work reports etc                                 Daily attendance and sickness records have to be kept alongside individual records of what work is carried out and on which projects. This is for project costing purposes and for traceability of components in case of problems arising.                                  Traceability is a vital activity both at material and component level and the workshop manager is responsible for maintaining a database of everything purchased work done and by whom.                                 The assistant workshop manager is responsible for the quality of the work carried out and performs incoming and outgoing inspection on all parts and assemblies or delegates that work.                                 In a potentially very dangerous working environment the manager is responsible maintaining safe working practices, keeping COSHH (Control of Substances Hazardous to Health) information up to date and ensuring everybody is conversant with this information.                                 Ensure all procedures and work instructions are kept up to date.                                 Protect company asset and resources, manpower, building, machine, vehicles.                                 Monitor departmental KPIs.                                 Assistant Workshop manager will manage the manpower of production line, workshop manager is responsible for his team performance and productivities on monthly basis.                                  Ensure all work orders are managed correctly                                 You will need to work closely with the quality department to deal with any NCRs.                                 Run daily meetings, along with weekly briefings, to ensure that teams are clearly focused.                                 Accountable for the safety of workshop personnel and provision of a safe workplace, including the production of Risk Assessments and Safe Systems of work.                                 Responsible for the implementation of 5S and other HSEQ standard within the workshop.                                 Conduct final check for all Tools and Spares before release to project site and ensure all checklists to be signed properly.                                 Assures administrative work on workshop rent, utilities management, part time hiring of lifting equipment, vehicles, manpower support                                     Has an authority to take disciplinary                             actions on parties not following the process, and especially when having an impact on:                                   - Asset Value;                                 - tool quality;                                 - safety;                                 -reporting                                   Ensures tools and spare parts are stored in proper condition and in suitable environment                                 Ensures Operations supplies all runs reports to TM                                   Perform other duties as assigned by management and/or Supervisor. column2: This position will be responsible for developing, instituting and maintaining a Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) program for the plant.     Key responsibilities:       Lead and execute the TPM and 5S culture and program for the plant as well as guide the company standards within the plant and serve as a change agent for continuous improvement throughout the operation. Oversee and coordinate all HR activities including knowledge management, HR Information Systems, welfare and disciplinary matters.         Drive TPM events within the plant and train the equipment operators and supervisors how to maintain the equipment s as well as participating in continuous improvement programs.         Coordinate with the operations, maintenance and engineering teams to develop and improve autonomous, preventative, predictive, and reliability maintenance programs.         Provide coaching, mentoring and training on the application of TPM methodology, culture, and tools in one-on-one and group settings to reinforce knowledge and skills attained during TPM training.         Provide training on Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), PDCA Principles, Root Cause Problem-Solving Techniques, Theory of Constraints, Visual Management, 5S, Autonomous Maintenance, Poka-Yoke, A3 Thinking Kaizen.         Execute a TPM learning/training plan for the plant.         Influencing moulding, polishing and fabrication functions within the plant to grow and evolve the TPM culture.       Education/Experience:       Should be an engineer preferably in Industrial or Mechanical or Electronics, from an institute of repute with over 10 years experience in plant environment with minimum of 5 years of experience in equipment maintenance roles.         Experience with Lean TPM manufacturing principles.       Specific Skills/Abilities:       Ability to work in large cross-functional teams and at multiple levels in the plant.         Displays strong coaching and influencing skills, along with the ability to inspire employees and managers on all levels.         Must be goal-oriented and proactive in problem solving, coupled with creativity and high energy levels         Passionate purpose driven.

column2: Job Description: As the Shift In Charge for the Compact Strip Production (CSP) Caster, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing the operational aspects of the casting process. You will be responsible for leading a team of operators, ensuring the production targets are met, and maintaining the highest standards of safety, quality, and efficiency. Key Responsibilities: CSP Caster Operations:  Manage and oversee the day-to-day operations of the CSP Caster, ensuring smooth and efficient production processes. Team Leadership:  Lead and motivate a team of operators and technicians, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure optimal performance. Production Planning:  Collaborate with the production planning team to ensure that production targets are met while maintaining quality standards. Quality Control:  Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the production of high-quality products that meet or exceed customer specifications. Safety Compliance:  Ensure a safe working environment by adhering to safety protocols and guidelines, conducting regular safety audits, and promoting a safety-first culture. Equipment Maintenance:  Coordinate with the maintenance team to schedule and execute preventive maintenance activities to minimize downtime and ensure the longevity of equipment. Continuous Improvement:  Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance efficiency and reduce costs. Reporting and Documentation:  Maintain accurate production records, prepare shift reports, and communicate key performance indicators to higher management. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Metallurgical Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in a Compact Strip Production (CSP) Caster unit. Strong leadership and team management skills. In-depth knowledge of CSP casting processes and equipment. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Familiarity with safety regulations and quality control standards.

column2: DM Manager - Maint:      About CMR       CMR Green Technologies Limited formerly known as Century Metal Recycling Limited is Indias largest producer of Aluminium and Zinc die-casting alloys with a combined annual capacity of over approx. 4, 18, 000 MT per annum. Since its inception in 2006, it has maintained its fast-paced growth by leveraging latest technology and continuous improvement. CMR, which recycles aluminium scrap to make alloy, has 28-30 percent market share in India and is nearly three times larger than its nearest competitor. We are having strong presence at PAN India level (North, West & South) with 13 manufacturing units, 5000 strong workforce and supplies to major automotive industry in India including tier one OEMs like Maruti Suzuki , Honda Cars , Bajaj Auto , Hero MotoCorp and Royal Enfield Motors. This upcoming State-of-art Plant will consist of new emerging technologies in metal recycling and will help in reduction of emission intensity. column2: Ensure delivery of Engineering Services as per ITC standards, safety norms and regulatory requirements. Ensure execution of CAPEX requirements of the factory.               Relevant Experience         Engineering graduate (Mechanical) with a minimum of 6 years of experience out of which 3-4 years in similar Industry(Foods/FMCG)     Knowledge and Business Understanding           Strong knowledge of basic working principles of utilities like HVAS, Boilers, ETPs, water treatment     Basic Knowledge of latest technology with respect to equipments and engineering developments       Strong Knowledge of foods related statutory requirements       Strong Knowledge of engineering services providers and vendors       Good understanding of foods / FMCG manufacturing processes           Skills             Team management skills       Inter personal skills       Planning and coordination skills       Decision making ability       Negotiation skills                     Requirements              ?       1Identify and prepare plans for the required maintenance and engineering services for the plant. Based on same, recommend the     engineering budget to the Operations Manager. Define norms for engineering stores, monitor and review the implementation of preventive maintenance schedule.     Prepare engineering related budgets (e.g. spare-part budget, engineering services budget, engineering modification budget) based on historical trends and current requirements; Submit the budget to the Operations Manager for inputs; Jointly finalize the budget; Identify the spare parts required for engineering services; Evaluate the procurement cost of the spare parts based on the approved budget; Identify the vendors for spare parts; Participate in price negotiation for spare parts; Define engineering store norms and ensure spare parts availability as per the norms; Prepare preventive maintenance schedule based on OEM manuals for all the equipments; Monitor and review the implementation of preventive maintenance schedule IN ORDER TO ensure smooth preventive maintenance and spares management at the plant           2     Based on inputs from production team, identify quality and process improvement initiatives. Prepare action plan for the same, drive     execution and monitor progress.     Seek requirements from the production team for improvement initiatives with respect to quality improvements, reduction in change over time, machine downtime; Analyze root cause for the machine downtime (process issue, product issue etc); Identify the requirements of the equipment / engineering services to improve quality and reduce downtime / change-over time; Prepare the action plan for the improvement initiative; Modify the existing machinery to reduce the downtime and change-over time; Conduct cost benefit analysis in case new machinery needs to be procured to reduce the down time / change-over time; Identify and select the vendors basis the cost benefit analysis; Coordinate for installation of the machinery IN ORDER TO improve the overall efficiency of processes with respect to reduction in downtime and change-over time           3Identify and recommend requirements of new equipments/engineering services for existing lines to meet/improve plant performance. Justify, recommend vendors and execute smooth installation, commissioning and stabilization. Provide support to Manager Projects in new capacity installation projects.         Identify the requirement of new equipment / engineering services for development of new product, improve productivity, cost reduction, asset replacement, utility and infrastructure up gradation; Identify vendors     for the new equipments; Obtain vendor quotes and evaluate technical feasibility of the vendors; Shortlist vendors and prepare justification note based on technical feasibility; Present vendor recommendation and justification note to Plant Manager for vendor selection; Participate in price negotiation with the vendors. Install / commission the equipment at plant; Evaluate the equipment on various performance parameters during commissioning; Handover the equipment to production team once     the commissioning is completed.           4Deploy resources to production team to maintain machine upkeep and reduce downtime. Resolve day to day escalated issues to ensure smooth operations.     Deploy resources to production team with respect to machinery upkeep and reduction in downtime; Resolve escalated issues on machinery maintenance IN ORDER TO ensure smooth production operations           5For New SKU Manufacturing , deliver machine readiness (change parts) as per agreed norms and defined timelines.     Identify vendors for the new change parts based on specifications received for new SKU; Obtain vendor quotes and evaluate technical feasibility of the vendors; Shortlist vendors and prepare justification note based on technical feasibility; Present the vendor recommendation and justification note to Plant Manager for vendor selection; Participate in price negotiation with the vendors; Follow-up for release of purchase order once the vendor is selected; Follow-up with the vendor for the receipt of the new change part; Install / commission the new change part at the plant; Follow-up with finance team for release of payment for the new change parts N ORDER TO ensure change parts readiness for new SKU manufacturing           6Monitor and review performance of maintenance and utilities related indices. Identify gaps, recommend actions and execute the same.     Monitor and review utilities related key performance indicators like power consumption, fuel consumption on daily basis; Prepare weekly performance reports; Consolidate weekly reports on monthly basis; Provide feedback on plant performance to the Operations Manager IN ORDER TO improve overall performance of the utilities at the plant           7Evaluate the gaps in equipments and engineering services according to EHS manual. Prepare action plan, once approved, close the same.     Evaluate the gaps in equipments and engineering services with respect to corporate EHS manual; Prepare the action plan to rectify the gaps; Coordinate with EHS auditors with respect to engineering related EHS norms for the plant; Provide justification about the engineering activities to the auditors during the audit; Prepare solutions to fulfill gaps identified by the auditors during the audit; Submit the solution report to the auditors and the Plant Manager for approval; Work upon the solutions once approved IN ORDER TO ensure that engineering services and equipments are complied to all EHS norms
