within the Manufacturing activities all the time without compromise.     a To check if m/c emergency switches are working properly or not     b To ensure that gangway is clear of any material     c To ensure that fire extinguisher are in working condition and kept at the proper place.     d Safety guard/switches are available as required.     e To ensure that no employee/casual is talking on mobile in the production area.     f To ensure accident-free shift     g To ensure that person in Chemical Room is wearing Safety Glasses, Mask, Gloves Aprin while working     h To ensure that person on kneader is wearing Mask Hand gloves while working.     i To ensure that nobody in the plant enters without wearing shoes.     j To ensure that person on Press is wearing Hand gloves while working.     4 To maintain quality of the product within declared norms.     a To ensure production of the material as per prescribed norms of density, hardness, thickness and size.     b To ensure the product dimensions as per customer requirement.     5 To keep a continuous focus on 4M and upgrade.     a Manpower     i To ensure the optimum utilization of manpower and any unnecssary deployment of CL should be avoided.     ii To verify CL attendance on daily basis and submit to HR on daily basis.     iii To ensure that no operator/CL is idle in the shift.     iv To maintain discipline among the Operators/CLs that they are not leaving the plant unnecessarily for Toilets/Drinking water excuses.     v To ensure that CL/Operators are coming and leaving the plant as per their shift timings, any discrepancy should be immediately reported to HR and strict action should be taken.     vi To ensure that CLs/Operators are going for lunch as per scheduled time and return back in 30 mins.     b Machine     i To ensure that the preventive maintenance of machines is carried out as per plan.     ii To coordinate with the maintenance dept regarding any predictive maintenance of the m/c.     iii To ensure that the maintenance persons are fulfilling their daily machine checking compliance.     iv To ensure neatness and cleanliness of the machines and paint work as and when required.     c Material     i To fill up daily RM Reco report without fail and report it to HOD.     ii To ensure that the RM SFG/FG are kept at the designated area within the yellow marking.     iii To ensure safe upkeep of RM SFG/FG.     iv To ensure that RM is handeled with care and transferred on trolleys in order to avoid any sweepage of material.     v. Daily physical stock to be reported to HOD in the WIP format.     vi To ensure proper stacking of Buns as per their grade and size in the designated area.     vii To ensure that FG is transferred on trolleys only.     d Method     i To maintain all process parameter records of every machine.     ii To maintain log-book on daily basis and ensure that all the entries are correct.     iii To prepare shift wise production report and submit to MIS dept on daily basis by 10 AM.     iv To monitor all the activities related to stock, transfer, packing etc.and ensure that all the activities are reported through prescribed slips.     v To display all the SOPs related to m/c operation, product specification, safety in the plant     vi To ensure that the Job card of every machine is displayed on it.     vii To maintain all the ISO documentation.     6 To keep declared inventory always in stock by ensuring appropriate space management within the storage area and manufacturing area.     7 To ensure the multiskilling of the operators and they are able to operate all the machines i.e. Kneader, Press, Bandsaw, slicing.     8 To find out gap areas and ensure regular training of operators/CLs in coordination with HR dept.      9To ensure realtime entries in ERP      10 To ensure proper housekeeping in the plant by implementing 5S.
column11: Condition monitoring, Housekeeping, ERP, Kaizen, MIS, ISO documentation, Packaging, Preventive maintenance, Predictive maintenance, WIP

column2: Job Title:  Factory Supervisor  Job Summary:  The Factory Supervisor in a food manufacturing setting is responsible for overseeing daily operations on the production floor, ensuring the efficient and timely production of high-quality food products. This role involves supervising production staff, maintaining safety and hygiene standards, Maintain documents and SOP and ensuring compliance with industry regulations. Key Responsibilities: Supervision and Leadership: Lead and manage a team of machine operators, production workers, including scheduling shifts, assigning tasks, and providing training and development. Foster a positive work environment, promoting teamwork and maintaining high morale among staff. Address employee concerns and performance issues promptly and effectively. Production Management: Monitor production processes to ensure efficiency and adherence to production schedules. Implement and oversee production plans, ensuring optimal use of resources and minimizing downtime. Troubleshoot and resolve any production issues that arise, coordinating with maintenance teams as needed. Quality Control: Ensure all products meet quality standards and specifications. Conduct regular inspections and quality checks throughout the production process. Implement and maintain quality control procedures and protocols. SOP will be implement in the facility  Safety and Compliance: Enforce strict adherence to safety and hygiene regulations, ensuring a safe working environment. Conduct regular safety audits and risk assessments. Ensure compliance with all relevant food safety and industry regulations (e.g., HACCP, GMP). Inventory and Equipment Management: Oversee the inventory of raw materials and finished products, ensuring adequate stock levels. Coordinate with procurement to order supplies and manage inventory. Ensure proper maintenance and operation of all production equipment. Reporting and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of production metrics, including output, efficiency, and quality. Prepare regular reports for senior management on production performance and areas for improvement. Document any incidents, issues, and corrective actions taken. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelors degree in Food Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field preferred. Experience:  Minimum of 3-5 years of supervisory experience in a food manufacturing environment. Skills: Strong leadership and team management abilities. Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in using production management software and tools. Knowledge of food safety standards and regulations. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
column11: Supervisory Skills, Factory, Factory Operations, Factory Administration, Plant, Factory Management, Manufacturing Operations, Manpower Handling, Supervision

column2: The Production Manager for Gypsum is responsible for overseeing and managing the production process of gypsum products, ensuring efficient operations, high-quality output, and adherence to safety and environmental standards. This role involves coordinating with various departments, managing production staff, optimizing production processes, and meeting production targets. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in manufacturing management, strong leadership skills, and in-depth knowledge of gypsum production. Key Responsibilities: Production Planning and Management: Develop and implement production plans and schedules to meet production targets and customer demand. Monitor production processes and make adjustments to optimize efficiency and productivity. Ensure that production operations are cost-effective and meet quality standards. Team Leadership and Supervision: Supervise and manage production staff, including hiring, training, and performance management. Foster a positive and productive work environment, encouraging teamwork and collaboration. Conduct regular team meetings to communicate production goals, updates, and safety protocols. Quality Control: Implement and maintain quality control procedures to ensure high-quality gypsum products. Monitor product quality at various stages of production and take corrective actions as necessary. Collaborate with the quality assurance team to address any quality issues and implement improvements. Process Optimization: Analyze production processes and identify areas for improvement to enhance efficiency and reduce waste. Implement lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement initiatives. Stay updated on industry best practices and technological advancements to improve production processes. Safety and Compliance: Ensure that all production activities comply with safety regulations and company policies. Conduct regular safety inspections and audits, addressing any safety concerns promptly. Promote a safety-first culture and provide ongoing safety training for production staff. Inventory and Resource Management: Manage inventory levels of raw materials, supplies, and finished products to ensure uninterrupted production. Coordinate with the procurement team to ensure timely delivery of materials and maintain good relationships with suppliers. Optimize resource allocation to minimize costs and maximize efficiency. Reporting and Documentation: Prepare and submit regular reports on production performance, including key metrics such as output, efficiency, and quality. Maintain accurate records of production activities, equipment maintenance, and inventory levels. Provide insights and recommendations for improving production operations. Equipment Maintenance and Troubleshooting: Oversee the maintenance and repair of production equipment to ensure smooth operations. Collaborate with the maintenance team to develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules. Troubleshoot and resolve any equipment issues that arise during production. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Manufacturing, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as a Production Manager or in a similar role within the gypsum or construction materials industry. Strong leadership and team management skills. Excellent knowledge of production management principles, quality control, and lean manufacturing. Familiarity with health and safety regulations and environmental standards. Proficiency in using production management software and Microsoft Office applications. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Working Conditions: Primarily based in a manufacturing plant environment, with exposure to noise, dust, and other industrial conditions. Regular interaction with production staff, maintenance team, quality assurance, and other departments. Standard working hours, with flexibility to work additional hours during peak production periods or to address production issues. Physical demands include standing for extended periods, walking, and occasional lifting and moving of materials. The role of the Production Manager for Gypsum is critical in ensuring the efficient and effective production of high-quality gypsum products. This position requires strong leadership, production management expertise, and a commitment to safety and continuous improvement. Drop your cv to sethuraman.s@cielhr.com
